venue.address_2: Near intersection of Young & Beauty Hill Rd.
venue.name: Swains Lake Boat Launch

item.description:
This event is open to all kayak types as well as canoes

Swain's Lake in Barrington, New Hampshire is often referred to as Union Lake on maps and documents as the present body of water was once two smaller Ponds. The lake covers 400 acres, is three miles long, 1 mile wide at its widest point, and is approximately 25 feet deep. Although. Swain's Lake is fed by a few small brooks most of the water consists of groundwater and collected rainfall from surrounding hills, as the lake is a natural watershed area. Swain's Lake drains into the Bellamy river, which in turn, feeds the Bellamy reservoir, a source of drinking Water for the City of Portsmouth, N. H. The original dam at Swains Lake was built in the early 1860's and enlarged in 1890 by the American Woolen Company. During the period of the mid to late 19th century textile mills were a booming industry in the State of New Hampshire. These mills used the abundant lakes, rivers and ponds in the state as an inexpensive source of power.

Click on picture above to view location of Boat Ramp

Directions:
* Take NH-125 North toward Kingston/Epping "Traffic Circle"
* At the traffic circle stay on NH-125 North "Straight"
* After 3mi Bear Slight left onto Beauty Hill Rd
* After 2.7 mi Turn left at Young Rd. Boat Launch is on left

Life vests aka PFDs must be worn when paddling with this group

Google Maps directions to Swains Lake Boat Launch
item.name: Swains Lake Paddle Barrington NH
